\b 3319.5.2.4 Crack detection inspection.  \b0 The equipment owner shall certify that crack detection inspections in accordance with rules promulgated by the commissioner have been performed, and provide a copy of the inspection results.\par
\par
\b 3319.5.2.5 Deficiencies.  \b0 If any deficiencies are uncovered by the inspections required by sections 3319.5.2.3 or 3319.5.2.4, a certificate of operation shall not be issued until the equipment owner provides information on the additional level of inspection undertaken to determine if the deficiency constitutes a hazardous condition.  \par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\li720\qj\b 3319.5.2.6 Operational certification.\b0   The equipment owner shall certify that:\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi-360\li1440\qj\tx1440\ulnone 1.\tab\ul At the time of the application, the \cf0 crane, derrick, or pile driver \cf1 is in good condition and safe working order, with no known hazardous conditions or maintenance problems that will compromise the safe operation of the crane, derrick, or pile driver.  \par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi-360\li1440\qj\ulnone 2.\tab\ul The equipment owner shall provide the crane, derrick, or pile driver to equipment user(s) in good condition and safe working order, with no known hazardous conditions or maintenance problems that will compromise the safe operation of the crane, derrick, or pile driver\par
\ulnone 3.\tab\ul All maintenance, repairs, modifications, or replacements made to the crane, derrick, or pile driver by or with the knowledge of the equipment owner shall be in accordance with section 3319.11.\par
\ulnone 4.\tab\ul The equipment owner shall notify the department of all accidents involving the crane, derrick, or pile driver in accordance with section 3319.5.11.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\li360\ri-72\qj\b\par
3319.5.3 Provisions of initial application.\b0   To request an initial certificate of operation, the equipment owner shall file an application containing all the information required by section 3319.5.2 and the following \cf0 information required by \cf1 sections \cf0 3319.5.3.1 through 3319.5.3.3.\cf1\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\ri-72\qj\cf0\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\li720\ri-72\qj\b 3319.5.3.1 Disclosure of history.\b0   The equipment owner shall:\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi-360\li1440\ri-72\qj\tx1440\ulnone 1.\tab\ul Disclose the date of manufacture of the crane, derrick, or pile driver;\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi-360\li1440\ri-72\qj\ulnone 2.\tab\ul Disclose the age of components that will be tracked as required by section 3319.5.2.2;\par
\ulnone 3.\tab\ul Disclose if there is a manufacturer currently providing servicing and technical support to the crane, derrick, or pile driver;\par
\ulnone 4.\tab\ul Disclose if the crane, derrick, or pile driver has been in the continuous ownership of the equipment owner since it was manufactured, and if not, the name and contact information of previous owners;\par
\ulnone 5.\tab\ul Disclose the type of work the crane, derrick, or pile driver has typically been used for; and\par
\ulnone 6.\tab\ul Disclose if the crane, derrick, or pile driver has ever been involved in an accident that has damaged \cf1 the structural, electrical, mechanical, operational systems, or safety devices of the \cf0 crane, derrick, or pile driver\cf1 , and, if so, disclose what steps were taken to repair the \cf0 crane, derrick, or pile driver\cf1 .  \cf0\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\ri-72\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\li720\ri-72\qj\b 3319.5.3.2 Certification of components.\b0   The equipment owner shall:\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi-360\li1440\ri-72\qj\tx1440\ulnone 1.\tab\ul Certify that all parts and components of the crane, derrick, or pile driver, either original or replacement, are supplied by the manufacturer; and\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi-360\li1440\ri-72\qj\cf1\ulnone 2.\tab\ul Certify that all repairs or modifications made to the \cf0 crane, derrick, or pile driver \cf1 have been in accordance with all manufacturer requirements, made by the manufacturer or a manufacturer\rquote s representative where the manufacturer so requires, and provide at least the manufacturer\rquote s original factor of safety.\cf0\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\ri-72\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\li720\ri-72\qj\b 3319.5.3.3 Manufacturer certification alternative.  \b0 Where the equipment owner is unable to provide the information and certification required by sections 3319.5.3.1 and 3319.5.3.2 due to incomplete records or change of ownership, the equipment owner shall provide certification from the crane, derrick, or pile driver manufacturer or successor manufacturer that currently provides service and technical support to the crane, derrick, or pile driver that, upon inspection by the manufacturer, the manufacturer has found the crane, derrick, or pile driver to be in good condition and safe \cf1 working order, with no known hazardous conditions or maintenance problems that will compromise the safe operation of the \cf0 crane, derrick, or pile driver\cf1 .\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\li360\qj\b 3319.5.4 Approval.\b0   \cf0 Upon the department\rquote s approval of the crane, derrick, or pile driver device application, the department shall issue a certificate of operation for the crane, derrick, or pile driver.\par
\cf1\par
\cf0\b 3319.5.5 Amendments.\b0   \cf1 An existing certificate of operation may be amended by \cf0 the equipment owner.  \par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi360\li360\qj An amendment shall be required where components, including but not limited to boom or mast sections, jibs, extensions, attachments, or other equipment not provided for in the certificate of operation are added.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\li360\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi360\li360\ri-72\qj Upon the department\rquote s approval of the amendments submitted, the department shall issue an amended certificate of operation.  \cf1\b\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\ri-72\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\li360\ri-72\qj 3319.5.6 Renewal of the certificate of operation.\b0   Certificates of operation shall be renewed in accordance with sections 3319.5.6.1 and 3319.5.6.2. \b\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\li720\ri-72\qj 3319.5.6.1  Renewal for m\cf0 obile cranes, articulating boom cranes, \cf1 self-erecting\b0  \cf0\b tower cranes, derricks permanently affixed to a building, and pile drivers.  \b0 The certificate of operation for a mobile crane, articulating boom crane, self-erecting tower crane, derrick permanently affixed to a building, or pile driver shall expire one year from the date of issuance, and the equipment owner shall renew the certificate of operation each year in accordance with section 3319.5.2.  \cf1\par
\cf0\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi360\li720\ri-72\qj If the owner of the crane, derrick, or pile driver applies for the renewal of a certificate of operation within not more than 60 nor less than 30 days prior to the date of its expiration, such equipment may continue to operate until the department grants or denies a renewed certificate of operation.  If the application is not received within this time period, the certificate of operation shall expire at the end of the one year period.  Expired certificates of operation shall be renewed in accordance with section 3319.5.7\cf1 .\cf0\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\ri-72\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\li720\ri-72\qj\b 3319.5.6.2 Renewal of the certificate of operation for crawler cranes, tower cranes, and derricks not permanently affixed to a building.\b0   The certificate of operation for a crawler crane, tower crane, or derrick not permanently affixed to a building shall\cf1  be valid for only one job site and shall expire one year from the date of issuance.  Where such jobs are to extend beyond one year, the equipment owner shall file for a three month extension of the certificate of operation at the one year mark and every three months there after.  Such applications for an extension shall contain the information required by section 3319.5.2.\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi360\li720\ri-72\qj If the owner of the crane or derrick files for the extension within not more than 14 nor less than 7 days prior to the date of expiration of the certificate of operation, such crane or derrick may continue to operate until the department grants or denies the extension.  If the application for an extension is not filed within this time period, the application may be filed at a later date, but the crane or derrick shall not be operated when the certificate of operation expires and shall not resume operation until the department grants the extension.  \par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\li720\ri-72\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi360\li720\ri-72\qj At the end of a job, the extension of the certificate of operation for the crane or derrick shall expire.  The certificate of operation must be renewed prior to the start of a new job in accordance with section 3319.5.7.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\b\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\li360\ri-72\qj\cf0 3319.5.7 Expired certificates of operation.\b0   Equipment owners of cranes, derricks, or pile drivers with an expired certificate of operation may renew an expired certificate of operation by filing an application to renew a certificate of operation in accordance with section 3319.5.2, and the supplemental requirements listed in section 3319.5.7.1, provided that the expired certificate of operation was issued to the same equipment owner, and provided that the same equipment owner has owned the crane, derrick, or pile driver during the entire period the certificate of operation has been expired.  If not, an application for an initial certificate of operation in accordance with section 3319.5.3 shall be filed.\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi360\li360\qj A crane, derrick, or pile driver possessing an expired certificate of operation shall not be operated until the department grants a new or renewed certificate of operation.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\li360\ri-72\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\li720\ri-72\qj\b 3319.5.7.1 Supplemental requirements.\b0   An application to renew an expired certificate of operation shall be accompanied by an affidavit from the equipment owner:\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi-360\li1440\ri-72\qj\tx1440\ulnone 1.\tab\ul Certifying that the crane, derrick, or pile driver has been in the continuous ownership of the equipment owner since the expiration of the certificate of operation;\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi-360\li1440\ri-72\qj\ulnone 2.\tab\ul Disclosing the type and location of work the crane, derrick, or pile driver has been used for since the expiration of the certificate of operation;\par
\ulnone 3.\tab\ul Certifying that since the expiration of the certificate of operation the crane, derrick, or pile driver has been maintained, repaired, modified, and replaced in accordance with section 3319.11.\par
\cf1\ulnone 4.\tab\ul Disclosing repairs, modifications, and replacements made to tracked components since the expiration of the certificate of operation in accordance with section 3319.5.10; and\cf0\par
\ulnone 5.\tab\ul Disclosing if the crane, derrick, or pile driver has been involved in an accident since the expiration of the certificate of operation in accordance with section 3319.5.11\cf1 .\cf0\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\cf1\b\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\li360\qj 3319.5.8 Provisions for boom sections, jibs and attachments.\b0   All boom sections, jibs, or other attachments for a crane, derrick, or pile driver shall be listed in the certificate of operation.  Where a new boom section, jib, or other attachment is to be added to a crane, derrick, or pile driver after a certificate of operation has been issued, the certificate of operation shall be amended.  Such boom, jib, or other attachment shall not be installed or used until the amended certificate of operation is issued by the department.  No boom section, jib, or other attachment not authorized by the certificate of approval shall be permitted to be listed under a certificate of operation.\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\li720\qj\b Exception:\b0   Boom sections, jibs, or other attachments for a mobile crane, articulating boom crane, self-erecting tower crane, derrick \cf0 permanently affixed to a building\cf1 , or pile driver, but not a crawler crane, tower crane, or derrick not permanently affixed to a building, may be used on equipment separate from which they are listed provided the following conditions are met:\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi-360\li1440\qj\tx1440\ulnone 1.\tab\ul Such items are provided for in the certificate of approval for the equipment for which they are to be used;\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi-360\li1440\qj\ulnone 2.\tab\ul Such items are to be used on a crane, derrick, or pile driver possessing a valid certificate of operation;\par
\ulnone 3.\tab\ul Such items come from a separate crane, derrick, or pile driver with a valid certificate of operation and such items are listed under that certificate of operation;\par
\ulnone 4.\tab\ul The crane, derrick, or pile driver from which the items come and the crane, derrick, or pile driver on which the items are to be used are owned by the same equipment owner; \par
\ulnone 5.\tab\ul Such items have been inspected, repaired, modified, replaced, maintained, and certified, and all accidents involving such items reported in accordance with the requirements for the certificate of operation for the crane, derrick, or pile driver under which they are listed; and\par
\ulnone 6.\tab\ul The crane, derrick, or pile driver notice application in connection with a certificate of on-site inspection, as provided in section 3319.6, notes such items are from a separate crane, derrick, or pile driver.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\cf0\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\li360\qj\b 3319.5.9 Operation.\b0   A crane, derrick, or pile driver requiring a certificate of operation shall not be operated if it:\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi-360\li1080\qj\tx1080\ulnone 1.\tab\ul Does not possess a valid certificate of operation;\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi-360\li1080\qj\ulnone 2.\tab\ul Includes components other than those listed in the certificate of operation as required by section 3319.5.2.1, except for components installed or used in accordance with section 3319.5.8;\par
\ulnone 3.\tab\ul Is found not to be in good condition or safe working order, or is found to possess a safety hazard;\par
\ulnone 4.\tab\ul Has not been inspected in accordance with the provisions of section 3319 of the building code or rules promulgated by the commissioner; or\par
\ulnone 5.\tab\ul Has not been maintained, repaired, modified, or replaced in accordance with section 3319.11.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\li360\ri-72\qj\b 3319.5.10 Tracked components.\b0   Where a component required to be tracked pursuant to section 3319.5.2.2 has been repaired, modified, or replaced by or with the knowledge of the equipment owner, either within or outside of New York City, such shall be reported to the department by the equipment owner.  The certificate of operation for the crane, derrick, or pile driver shall be considered invalid upon conducting the repair, modification, or replacement.  The crane, derrick, or pile driver shall not resume operation within New York City until an amended certificate of operation is approved by the department.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\b\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\li360\qj 3319.5.11 Accident reporting.  \b0 When a crane, derrick, or pile driver has been involved in an accident, either within or outside of New York City that damages the structural, electrical, mechanical, or operational systems, or safety devices of the equipment, the equipment owner shall notify the department, in writing, of the accident.  The certificate of operation for the crane, derrick, or pile driver shall be considered invalid upon the occurrence of the accident.  The crane, derrick, or pile driver shall not resume operation within New York City until an amended certificate of operation is approved by the department.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\cf1\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\li360\qj\b 3319.5.12 Sale of equipment.\b0   \cf0 When a crane, derrick, or pile driver possessing an active certificate of operation is sold to a new equipment owner, the department shall be notified, in writing, of the sale by the new equipment owner within 14 days after the date of sale.  The new equipment owner shall include a copy of the bill of sale in the notification and certify that he/she has received from the previous equipment owner a copy of all logs and records required to have been maintained by the previous equipment owner by section 3319.11.  \par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi360\li360\qj The new equipment owner shall not operate the crane, derrick, or pile driver within New York City until he/she has filed an application for a renewed certificate of operation in accordance with section 3319.5.2 and the department has granted a renewed certificate of operation for the crane, derrick, or pile driver.  Where a component required to be tracked pursuant to section 3319.5.2.2 has been repaired, modified, or replaced by or with the knowledge of either the old or new equipment owner, such shall be disclosed to the department in accordance with section 3319.5.10.  Where such equipment has been involved in an accident while under the ownership of either the old or new owner, such shall be disclosed to the department in accordance with section 3319.5.11.\par
\par
All maintenance, repairs, modifications, and replacements made to the crane, derrick, or pile driver by either the old owner or new owner shall be in accordance with section 3319.11.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\cf1\b\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\li360\qj 3319.5.13 Suspension or revocation of a certificate of operation.\b0   The department shall suspend or revoke a certificate of operation in accordance with the provisions of \cf0\'a728-105.10 of the administrative code.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\par
\par

\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\li360\qj\ul\b 3319.6.1 Conformity with the certificate of approval and certificate of operation.\b0   No application for a certificate of on-site inspection, either an initial application or renewal application, may be filed unless \cf0 there is a valid certificate of approval and certificate of operation for the crane, derrick, or pile driver issued by the department.  No certificate of on-site inspection, or amendment to a certificate of on-site inspection, shall be granted for a crane, derrick, or pile driver proposed to be operated beyond that in the approved load charts, or provided with attachments or other equipment not provided for in the certificate of approval or certificate of operation.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\li360\ri-72\qj\cf1\b\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\li720\ri-72\qj\cf0 Exception:\b0   An application for a certificate of on-site inspection may be filed when the crane, derrick, or pile driver has an expired certificate of operation, provided the certificate of operation is renewed in accordance with section 3319.5.7 prior to the issuance of the certificate of on-site inspection.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\ri-72\qj\cf1\b\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\li360\ri-72\qj 3319.6.2 Application.\b0   \cf0 To apply for a certificate of on-site inspection, an engineer retained by the equipment user shall file a crane, derrick, or pile driver application known as a crane, derrick or pile driver notice application.  The notice application shall contain the information required by sections 3319.6.2.1 through 3319.6.2.6. Accompanying plans and calculations shall be signed and sealed by the engineer, and include the project address.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\cf1\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\li720\qj\b 3319.6.2.1 \cf0 Ground and subsurface conditions.\b0   Where a crane, derrick, or pile driver is proposed to be located on the ground, the notice application shall include the following:\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi-360\li1440\qj\tx1440\ulnone 1.\tab\ul Certification from the engineer submitting the notice application that he/she has inspected the ground conditions at the proposed location of the crane, derrick, or pile driver and accounted for them in his or her design;\cf1\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi-360\li1440\qj\ulnone 2.\tab\ul Identification of all pertinent ground and subsurface conditions, including but not limited to elevations and slopes, all \cf0 sheeting, shoring, retaining walls, or excavations, all vaults, foundations, utilities, or other subsurface structures that could be impacted by the presence of the crane, derrick, or pile driver, along with identification of assumed soil, street, and sidewalk bearing values; and\cf1\par
\cf0\ulnone 3.\tab\ul Certification, supported by calculations, demonstrating that the crane, derrick, or pile driver, in all conditions of loading, will not overload the street, soil, or sidewalk, or any ground, utility, vault, or subsurface condition identified in item number 2 above.\cf1\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\ri-72\qj\cf0\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\li720\qj\b 3319.6.2.2 Footing.\b0   The notice application shall include plans for \cf1 the footing of the crane, derrick, or pile driver, including matting needed to support and distribute the loads of the \cf0 crane, derrick, or pile driver.  \cf1 The\cf0  notice application shall demonstrate the adequacy of the footing and/or matting for all conditions of loading, or certify that timber in accordance with section 3319.14.4 is adequate and shall be provided.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi360\li720\qj The location of outriggers shall be clearly marked.  If outriggers must be set at unequal positions, the engineer shall supply calculations verifying the stability of the crane, derrick, or pile driver.\cf1\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\ri-72\qj\cf0\b\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\li720\ri-72\qj 3319.6.2.3 Foundation.\b0   Where a foundation, building, platform, or temporary structure is to support a crane, derrick, or pile driver, including but not limited to tie-in connections for tower cranes or the anchorages of derricks, the notice application shall contain all plans and calculations necessary to demonstrate the following, both for in service and out of service conditions:\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi-360\li1440\ri-72\qj\tx1440\ulnone 1.\tab\ul The adequacy of the foundation, building, platform, or temporary structure to support the crane, derrick, or pile driver in all conditions of loading; and\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi-540\li2340\ri-72\qj\tx2340 1.1.\tab Any modifications needed to enable an existing foundation, building, platform, or temporary structure to support the crane, derrick, or pile driver in all conditions of loading; or\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi-540\li2340\ri-72\qj 1.2.\tab The design of any foundation, platform, or temporary structure needed to be constructed to support the crane, derrick, or pile driver in all conditions of loading.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi-360\li1440\ri-72\qj\tx1440\ulnone 2.\tab\ul Means of supporting and bracing the equipment; and\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi-360\li1440\ri-72\qj\ulnone 3.\tab\ul Reactions imposed on the foundation, building, platform, or temporary structure by the crane, derrick, or pile driver, including those due to impact and wind.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\li1800\ri-72\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi360\li720\ri-72\qj Where the building is a building under construction, the application shall also contain a copy of the crane plans stamped \ldblquote reviewed for loads imposed\rdblquote  by the registered design professional for the building, or a letter from the registered design professional for the building stating that he or she has reviewed the crane plans(s) for the loads it will impose on the building and attesting to the adequacy of the building to support the loads.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\li360\ri-72\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\li720\ri-72\qj\b 3319.6.2.4 Setup plan.\b0   The notice application shall include site plan(s) and elevation plan(s) showing the following:\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi-360\li1440\ri-72\qj\tx1440\ulnone 1.\tab\ul The intended location of crane, derrick, or pile driver;\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi-360\li1440\ri-72\qj\ulnone 2.\tab\ul Areas where the crane or pile driver is proposed to travel on site;\par
\ulnone 3.\tab\ul Temporary construction such as sidewalk sheds, scaffolds, and hoists; \par
\ulnone 4.\tab\ul All surrounding buildings and structures within 125% of the maximum swing radius and swing path of the crane, derrick, or pile driver, with details including items such as balconies and setbacks;\par
\ulnone 5.\tab\ul Above ground utilities, street lights, traffic lights, antennas, electrical lines, phone or other lines, bridges, viaducts, and infrastructure within the maximum swing radius of the crane, derrick, or pile driver; and\par
\ulnone 6.\tab\ul Details demonstrating that the crane, derrick, or pile driver will not come into contact with any structures or obstructions.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\ri-72\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\li720\ri-72\qj\b 3319.6.2.5 Configuration plan.\b0   The notice application shall include site plan(s) and elevation plan(s) showing the crane, derrick, or pile driver in all configurations for which it will be utilized at the job site, including showing all proposed boom lengths, jibs, and other attachments.  For tower cranes, all proposed counterweights, including the amounts and configurations, shall be supplied.\par
\par
\b 3319.6.2.6 Assembly, jumping, and disassembly plan.\b0   Where a crane, derrick, or pile driver requires assembly, jumping, or disassembly, including boom assembly, or the attachment of jibs or other attachments, or requires the use of assist cranes, an assembly and disassembly plan showing all phases of the assembly and disassembly shall be included.  For tower cranes, the requirements of section 3319.8 shall apply.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\ri-72\qj\b\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\li360\ri-72\qj 3319.6.3 Approval.\b0   Upon approval of the crane, derrick, or pile driver notice application, a copy of such approval shall be given to the applicant.  The crane, derrick, or pile driver shall not be set up or installed until the department has given such approval.  Prior to setup or installation, the certifications required by section 3319.6.3.1 and 3319.6.3.2 shall be provided to the department.\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\li720\qj\b Exceptions:  \par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi-360\li1440\qj\tx1440\ulnone 1.\tab\ul Tower crane foundation.  \b0 The foundation for a tower crane may be installed prior to the submittal of a crane notice application provided that foundation plans for the tower crane foundation containing the information required by sections 3319.6.2.1 and 3319.6.2.3 are submitted to the department for review and approval prior to the installation of the tower crane foundation.  This information does not need to reference a specific crane or crane set-up.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi-360\li1440\qj\ulnone\b 2.\tab\ul Tower crane first mast section.\b0   The first mast section of a tower crane may be installed without an approved notice application from the department for the tower crane, provided the assist crane or derrick possesses a valid certificate of on-site inspection, and provided the mast section is inspected and installed in accordance with rules promulgated by the commissioner.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\li720\qj\par
\b 3319.6.3.1 Owner certification.\b0   Prior to setup or installation of the crane, derrick, or pile driver, the equipment owner shall certify that the crane, derrick, or pile driver has been inspected, maintained, modified, repaired, and replaced by the owner in accordance with the provisions of the certificate of operation and section 3319.11, and that the crane, derrick, or pile driver has been provided to the equipment user \cf1 in a good condition and safe working order, with no known hazardous conditions or maintenance problems that will compromise the safe operation of the crane, derrick, or pile driver.  The certification shall be in the form of a letter, specific to the job.\par
\par
\b 3319.6.3.2 User certification.\b0   Prior to setup or installation of the crane, derrick, or pile driver, the equipment user shall certify that he/she shall, while the crane, derrick, or pile driver is in his or her possession:\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi-360\li1440\qj\tx1440\ulnone 1.\tab\ul Set up and operate the crane, derrick, or pile driver in accordance with the provisions of the approved load chart, certificate of approval, certificate of operation, and certificate of on-site inspection, or where such equipment is proposed to be operated under an exemption from such certificate, the equipment is operated in accordance with the provisions of the exemption;\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi-360\li1440\qj\ulnone 2.\tab\ul Maintain the crane, derrick, or pile driver in accordance with section 3319.11;\par
\ulnone 3.\tab\ul Maintain a maintenance log in accordance with section 3319.11;\par
\ulnone 4.\tab\ul Maintain an inspection log in accordance with rules promulgated by the commissioner;\par
\ulnone 5.\tab\ul Not make any repairs, modifications, or replacements to the crane, derrick, or pile driver without the knowledge and authorization of the equipment owner in accordance with section 3319.11; \par
\ulnone 6.\tab\ul Immediately notify the department and the equipment owner of any accident involving the crane, derrick, or pile driver; \par
\ulnone 7.\tab\ul Provide flagperson(s), fences, barricades, or other adequate means to keep the public from coming into contact with the crane, derrick, or pile driver, or passing through a hoisting zone in accordance with section 3319.14; \par
\ulnone 8.\tab\ul Provide footing in accordance with section 3319.14;\par
\ulnone 9.\tab\ul Not permit hoisting over occupied buildings unless the provisions of section 3319.14 are satisfied;\par
\ulnone 10.\tab\ul Obtain all other permits and notifications required by section 3319.14;\par
\ulnone 11.\tab\ul Not permit the operation of the crane, derrick, or pile driver when a hazardous condition is known to exist; and\par
\ulnone 12.\tab\ul Not permit the set up or use of the crane, derrick, or pile driver without a valid approved application or certificate of on-site inspection in accordance with section 3319.6.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi360\li1080\qj The certification shall be in the form of a letter, specific to the job.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\cf0\b\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\li360\ri-72\qj 3319.6.4 Issuance of the certificate of on-site inspection.\b0   Upon set up or installation, the crane, derrick, or pile driver shall not be operated until the crane, derrick, or pile driver has passed an inspection in accordance with rules promulgated by the department.  Upon satisfactory compliance, the approved crane, derrick, or pile driver notice application shall be deemed a certificate of on-site inspection, which shall expire one year from the date of issuance.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\li720\ri-72\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\li360\qj\b 3319.6.5 Assist cranes or derricks.\b0   Assist cranes or derricks are required to possess a valid certificate of on-site inspection.  Assist cranes or derricks shall not be utilized to assemble or disassemble a crane, derrick, or pile driver until the notice application for the equipment to be assembled or disassembled has been approved by the department and the assist crane or derrick possesses a valid certificate of on-site inspection.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\b\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\li360\qj 3319.6.6 Amendments.  \b0 An existing certificate of on-site inspection may be amended by a professional engineer on behalf of the equipment user.  Amendments shall be approved in the order which they were received.  Amendments shall be required where the crane, derrick, or pile driver is proposed to be set up, located, configured, or operated in a manner not provided for in the certificate of on-site inspection, or to be operated by a different equipment user.\par
\par
\b 3319.6.7 Operation.\b0   \cf1 The certificate of on-site inspection is valid only if the conditions and statements contained in the approved application are complied with and the crane, derrick, or pile driver is operated in conformance with the provisions of this section and the rules applicable thereto. \par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\li360\qj\b 3319.6.8 Suspension or revocation of a certificate of on-site inspection.  \b0 The department shall suspend or revoke a certificate of on-site inspection in accordance with the provisions of \cf0\'a728-105.10 of the \i Administrative Code\i0 .\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\ulnone\tab\'a78.  Chapter 33 of the New York city building code, is\fs20  \fs24 amended by adding a new section 3319.11 to read as follows:\ul\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\par
\cf1\b 3319.11 Maintenance, repairs, modifications, and replacements.\b0   Cranes, derricks, and pile drivers shall be maintained, repaired and modified in accordance with, and all replacement part(s) shall comply with, the requirements of sections 3319.11.1 and 3319.11.2.\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\li360\qj\b 3319.11.1 Maintenance.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\b0\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\li720\qj\b 3319.11.1.1 Manufacturer\rquote s maintenance procedures.\b0   Cranes, derricks, and pile drivers shall be maintained by equipment owners and equipment users in accordance with all manufacturer procedures.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\li360\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\li720\qj\b 3319.11.1.2 National maintenance standards.  \b0 Cranes, derricks, and pile driers shall be maintained by equipment owners and equipment users in accordance with the requirements and the applicable standard, listed below:\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi-360\li1440\qj\tx1440\cf0\ulnone 1.\tab\ul ASME B30.3-2004, for a tower crane;\cf1\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi-360\li1440\qj\ulnone 2.\tab\ul ASME B30.5-2007, for a mobile or crawler crane;\par
\ulnone 3.\tab\ul ASME B30.22-2005, for an articulating boom crane; \par
\ulnone 4.\tab\ul Standards identified in rules promulgated by the commissioner for self-erecting tower cranes;\par
\ulnone 5.\tab\ul ASME B30.6-2003, for a derrick; or\par
\ulnone 6.\tab\ul EN 996-1996 for pile drivers.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\li720\qj\par
\b 3319.11.1.3 Lubrication and oiling.  \cf0\b0 Lubrication and oiling shall be performed under the supervision of the crane, derrick, or pile driver operator, oiler, or maintenance mechanic and be performed in accordance with sections 3319.11.1 and 3319.11.2.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\li360\qj\cf1\b\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\li720\qj 3319.11.1.4 Jobsite maintenance logs.  \b0 Where a crane, derrick, or pile driver is operated on a job site within New York City, the equipment user shall maintain a log of all maintenance performed on the crane, derrick, or pile driver at the job site, and make such log available to the commissioner upon request.  The log shall also include information on all repairs, modifications, and replacements made to the crane, derrick, or pile driver at the job site.\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\li1080\qj\b Exception: \b0 Derricks permanently affixed to a building.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\li360\qj\par
\b 3319.11.2 Repairs, modifications, and replacements.\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\li720\qj 3319.11.2.1 Factor of safety for repairs, modifications, and replacements.  \b0 All repairs, modifications, or replacements made to a \cf0 crane, derrick, or pile driver \cf1 by or with the knowledge of the equipment owner shall provide at least the manufacturer\rquote s original factor of safety.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\b\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\li720\qj 3319.11.2.2 Manufacturer\rquote s repair, modification, and replacement procedures and equipment.  \b0 Beginning January 1, 2011, all repairs, modifications, or replacements made to a \cf0 crane, derrick, or pile driver \cf1 by or with the knowledge of the equipment owner shall be made in accordance with all manufacturer procedures and requirements, and shall be made by the manufacturer or a manufacturer\rquote s representative where the manufacturer so requires.  All part(s) or component(s) added to or replaced on the crane, derrick or pile driver shall be supplied by the equipment manufacturer or manufacturer approved vendor.  \par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\li1080\qj\b Exception: \b0 Where manufacturer procedures and/or requirements do not exist, or equipment manufacturer or manufacturer approved vendor part(s) or component(s) does not exist, such repair, modification, or replacement shall be conducted in accordance with the applicable national standard, listed in section 3319.11.2.3, and provide at least the manufacturer\rquote s original factor of safety.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\li720\qj\b 3319.11.2.3 National standards for repair, modification, and replacement.  \b0 Beginning January 1, 2011, all repairs, modifications, or replacements made to a \cf0 crane, derrick, or pile driver \cf1 by or with the knowledge of the equipment owner shall be in accordance with the applicable standard, listed below:\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi-360\li1440\qj\tx1440\cf0\ulnone 1.\tab\ul ASME B30.3-2004, for a tower crane;\cf1\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi-360\li1440\qj\ulnone 2.\tab\ul ASME B30.5-2007, for a mobile or crawler crane;\par
\ulnone 3.\tab\ul ASME B30.22-2005, for an articulating boom crane; \par
\ulnone 4.\tab\ul Standards identified in rules promulgated by the commissioner for self-erecting tower cranes;\par
\ulnone 5.\tab\ul ASME B30.6-2003, for a derrick; or\par
\ulnone 6.\tab\ul EN 996-1996 for pile drivers.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\li360\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\li720\qj\b 3319.11.2.4 Repair, modification, and replacement records.\b0   Beginning January 1, 2011, the equipment owner shall, for the life of the \cf0 crane, derrick, or pile driver\cf1 , maintain logs and records of all repairs, modifications, and replacements made by or with the knowledge of the equipment owner and make such logs and records available to the commissioner upon request.  If the equipment is sold, such logs and records shall be transferred to the new owner.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\li360\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\li720\ri-72\qj\b 3319.11.2.5 Equipment user notification of repairs, modifications, and replacements.\b0   An equipment user shall make no repairs, modifications, or replacements to a crane, derrick, or pile driver operating within New York City without the knowledge and authorization of the equipment owner.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\par

\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\ulnone\tab\'a711.\fs20   \fs24 Chapter 33 of the New York city building code, is\fs20  \fs24 amended by adding a new section 3319.14 to read as follows:\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\ul\par
\cf1\b 3319.14 Additional requirements.\b0   \par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\li360\qj\b 3319.14.1 Department of transportation.  \cf0\b0 Where a crane or pile driver is to be located on or hoisting operations are to occur over a street or sidewalk, a permit from the department of transportation shall be obtained by the equipment user.  A copy of this permit shall be included in the crane, derrick, or pile driver notice application.\par
\par
\b 3319.14.2 Pedestrians.\b0   No crane, derrick, or pile driver shall be located on a street, sidewalk, or in area accessible to the public, and no hoisting shall occur over a street, sidewalk, or area accessible to the public unless the equipment user provides \cf1 flagperson(s), fences, barricades, or other adequate means and \cf0 prevents the public from coming into contact with the \cf1 crane, derrick, or pile driver, or from passing through a hoisting zone.  A sidewalk shed shall not be considered adequate means to protect pedestrians in a hoisting zone.\cf0\par
\par
\b 3319.14.3 Occupied buildings.\b0   Loads shall not be carried over any occupied building unless the top two floors are vacated or overhead protection approved by the department is provided.\par
\par
\b 3319.14.4 Footing.  \b0 Footing shall be provided by the equipment user to distribute loads so as not to exceed the bearing capacity of the underlying material.  Footing under tires, crawler tracks, or outrigger pads shall be level within one percent.\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi360\li360\qj Where a crane or pile driver is to be located on a street or sidewalk, the pressure on such surface shall not exceed 3500 pounds per square foot (716.86 kg per square meter).  The pressure shall be distributed by the equipment user on the street or sidewalk by means of timber extending not less than twelve (12) inches (304.8 mm) beyond the base of the outriggers on all sides and sufficiently thick to uniformly distribute the pressure as required above of all the loads including the weight of the crane or pile driver, or by other means acceptable to the commissioner. The timber mats shall have a minimum thickness of two (2) inches (50.8 mm). All cranes or pile drivers equipped with steel tracks shall be supported by timber not less than six (6) inches (152.4 mm) thick and covering the entire base of the crane or pile driver.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\cf1\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\li360\qj\b 3319.14.5 Aviation hazards.\b0   All required applications and/or approvals related to the operation of a crane, derrick, or pile driver from the Federal Aviation Administration, including but not limited to any required pursuant to 14 CFR Part 77 and FAA Advisory Circular AC70/7460-2K, shall be obtained by the equipment user.  A copy of all required applications and/or approvals shall be kept on site, available to inspection by the commissioner.  \par
\par
\b 3319.14.6 Transit facilities.\b0   \cf0 If the body of a crane or pile driver is to be located within 200 feet (60.96 m) of a structure or vault owned by the Transit Authority, the approval of such is required.  Such approval shall be acquired by the equipment user and included in the crane, derrick, or pile driver notice application.\par
\cf1\par
\b 3319.14.7 Weekend operations.\b0   To operate a crane, derrick, or pile driver on a weekend, the equipment user must obtain approval from the department as required by \'a724-223 of the \i Administrative Code.\i0   \cf0\par
\par
